spell.name: Aether Aquatica

m.text: A gold statuette of a fish worth 20 gp, which the spell consumes, and a large body of water.

entries: From the depths of the water, you conjure a massive but gentle elemental to transport you across the waves. The conjured elemental is a Huge creature made of shimmering water, and it takes the shape of an aquatic creature of your choice. It has an AC of 19, 150 hit points, and a damage threshold of 20. It is immune to acid, poison, and psychic damage. The elemental has a swimming speed of 80 feet and cannot make attacks, though you can command it to take other actions on your turn.g

At your command, the elemental's mouth opens, creating a portal to an extradimensional space inside of it. You and up to nine other creatures of Medium size or smaller can fit in this space, which contains a common room, a cargo hold capable of storing 30 cubic feet of cargo, and quarters for yourself and your guests. The interior is fully furnished, and you can alter the number of quarters as well as the look of each area by spending 1 minute focusing on the desired change. The common room contains an oval window that shows the elemental's field of view. While you are inside the common room, you can direct the elemental to take actions.

When the spell ends, or if the elemental is reduced to 0 hit points, it slowly begins to disintegrate into tiny bubbles over the next {@dice 1d10} minutes. Once it has disappeared, creatures and objects not created by the spell are flung into random spaces within 5 feet of where the elemental used to be. If the elemental has 1 or more hit points remaining, you can extend the duration by casting the spell again.

spell.name: Aether Figment

m.text: An arcane focus or magical object worth at least 10 gp.

entries: You use an arcane focus or magical item in your possession to call forth a pale figment. The translucent figment has the stats of a CR 0 beast of your choice (chosen the first time you cast this spell on the object) but has the construct creature type. The figment takes on the form of the chosen creature while the used object floats at the core of the figment. The figment gains access to any traits or properties possessed by the item, has an Intelligence score of 10, and can speak any languages you know.

The construct is sentient and obeys your commands to the best of its ability. As an action, you can command the figment to revert to being an item or to turn back into a creature. While in its item form the figment can still see and hear as normal and can communicate with you telepathically out to a range of 60 feet. If the figment is reduced to 0 hit points, roll a {@dice d20}. On a result of 10 or lower, the item it was created from is destroyed. Magical items of rare or higher rarity have advantage on this roll.
You can only have one figment at a time. If you cast this spell while you already have a figment, you must choose which one to keep.

spell.name: Bad Berry
entries: You weave an insidious curse into a single piece of food. The foodstuff becomes far more appetizing to the senses: loaves and pies plump and exude an inviting aroma, apples become brightly colored and have a noticeable shine, and thin stews become meals fit for a king. Yet, however appealing the food may seem, it tastes of ash.

A creature that has even the smallest bite of the cursed food must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and becoming {@condition poisoned} on a failure or taking half as much damage on a success. The {@condition poisoned} effect lasts for 12 hours.

spell.name: Briar Bastion
entries: A defensive hedgerow of thorny rose-briar springs forth from the ground. You can choose to have the barrier form a wall up to 30 feet long and 5 feet tall, or a circle that is 15 feet in diameter and 10 feet tall. In either formation, the vegetation is 5 feet thick, providing three-quarters cover, and creatures on both sides of it are heavily obscured. A creature that enters the briar for the first time on its turn or starts its turn inside must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 3d4} piercing damage and its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Burrow

components.m: A small stone carving depicting a claw or a shovel.

entries: You conjure a 5-foot-wide hole in a solid surface within range. The hole appears to lead to an endless dark tunnel. While casting the spell, choose any number of creatures that you can see. When you or a chosen creature enters the hole, you or the creature is instantly teleported to a cozy den. Other creatures that enter the hole are immediately turned around and forced to exit it. Any spell, effect, or object that enters the hole cannot reach the den unless you allow it.

The den is an extradimensional space that resembles an underground burrow and is large enough to accomodate you and ten other Medium or smaller creatures. The atmosphere inside the den is always comfortable and dry. Until the spell ends, you can command the interior to become dimly lit or dark. A 5-foot-wide porthole in the den shows you the area outside the hole and can be used to exit the space. You cannot cast spells or attack through this opening.

Subsequent castings of this spell do not end the first effect, and these holes become new entrances to the den created by your first casting of this spell. Any creatures still inside the den when the spell ends appear outside the den in an unoccupied space within 20 feet of the entrance to the den.

spell.name: Cairith's Corral
entries: Shout a challenge and make a melee spell attack against a hostile creature that is Large or smaller. On a success, you summon a spectral spherical cage that traps both you and the hostile creature inside. The cage is 30 feet wide and 20 feet tall, and is an immobile, solid barrier that prevents matter from passing through it. It can be magically dispelled or suppressed (as if under the effects of the antimagic field spell). Creatures only partially within the perimeter of the cage and those too large to fit inside the cage are pushed away from the cage until they are completely outside it.
A creature inside the cage can't leave it by nonmagical means. The spell ends once you or the hostile creature are reduced to 0 hit points.

spell.name: Concussive Launch
entries: Your flesh hardens as jets of flame from your feet propel you with tremendous velocity. You rocket forward 60 feet in a direction of your choice without provoking attacks of opportunity. Each creature in your path must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and remains standing. Unsecured objects in your path take {@damage 4d10} bludgeoning damage, ignoring damage thresholds. If you deal damage to a creature or object in this way, you become {@condition incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. The spell discharges a concussive boom audible out to 300 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you increase the bludgeoning damage dealt to creatures by {@dice 1d8}, and the bludgeoning damage dealt to objects by {@dice 1d10}, for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cymatic Sight

components.m: A small ceramic plate and a lock of horse hair.

entries: You amplify your connection to the energies of the earth, granting you the ability to detect movement through vibrations. For the duration of the spell, you have {@sense tremorsense} out to a range of 60 feet.

The {@sense tremorsense} allows you to detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within range, provided that you and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same solid or liquid (for example, ground or water). Tremorsense can only be used to detect vibrations from a source that is in direct contact with the same solid or liquids you are in contact with. The {@sense tremorsense} cannot be used to detect flying creatures.

spell.name: Eat Rocks
entries: With a mighty shout, you conjure a collection of stones to pummel and distract your foe. One target within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage. Additionally, the next attack made against the target before the start of your next turn is made with advantage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), an{@dice d17}th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Elastic Tongue
entries: As you finish casting the spell, your tongue grows long and sticky like a toad's, shooting out from your mouth and targeting an object within range. The sticky tongue latches onto the object and pulls it to you.

If you have free hands, you can immediately wield the object; otherwise, it drops at your feet. If the object is being held or carried by a creature, the creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC to maintain its grip on the object.
If you target an object that is too heavy to move, like a wall or a large rock, you are instead pulled toward the object, provoking opportunity attacks as normal.

spell.name: Enthrall Plant

m.text: An obsidian amulet worth at least 500 gp, anointed with fresh animal blood.

entries: Imbuing a Large or smaller mundane plant with tendrils of shadowy magic, you take control of it, causing it to grow unnaturally and uproot into a sentient, mobile servant tied to your life force. For the duration of the spell, the plant's bark or leaves ripple with dark energy and it becomes a lumbering construct with the statistics of a shield guardian.

You have a telepathic link to your creation while you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to your construct while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "{@action Attack} that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the plant completes the order and receives no further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability.

As an action, you can take total and precise control of the plant. Until the end of your next turn, the plant takes only the actions you choose and doesn't do anything that you don't allow it to do. During this time, you can also cause it to take a reaction, but this requires you to expend your own reaction.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, you can concentrate on it for up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 8th level, you can concentrate on it for up to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 9th level or higher, the spell no longer requires concentration.

spell.name: Entomb
entries: The ground beneath an enemy softens to a mud-like consistency and begins to engulf and crush them. Choose one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} and take {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. A {@condition restrained} creature can attempt a new saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.
This spell has no effect on a creature that is not touching the ground.

spell.name: Etheral Claws
entries: Jagged, spectral claws surround your hands and feet, allowing you to attack with the ferocity of a beast. Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} slashing damage. If the attack roll scores a critical hit, the target takes an additional 5 slashing damage. After you make the attack, the spectral claws dissipate.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Fall Apart
entries: Using a quill, you draw a dotted line around a part of your body. This body part separates from you once you finish casting the spell. How you choose to separate your body is up to you. For example, you could make a dotted line around your waist to bisect yourself into a top half and a bottom half, or you could trace the dotted line around your eye, ear, or mouth to separate it from your face. The separation deals no damage and leaves no wound. If you occupy the same space as your detached body part, you can reattach it as an action.

You receive sensory information from your body part and can control it so long as you are on the same plane. Body parts that possess the ability to propel themselves (such as a hand that can skitter around on its fingers) can move up to half of your speed each turn, reducing your own movement speed by an amount equal to the distance the part travels. As a bonus action, you can take an action with your body part. The type of action is restricted by how you chose to separate yourself. For example, an eye can't speak, and a separated hand can't cast spells.

Your body part uses your armor class, and any damage dealt to it is transferred to you. Once the spell ends, or once your body part takes damage, it immediately dissipates in a ghostly wisp and appears reattached to you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can separate an additional body part from yourself for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Fillian's Wind Dance
entries: You begin a magical dance that harnesses the power of the wind. You must continue the dance to maintain concentration on the spell, which requires moving at least 5 feet each round after you cast it. While under the effect of the spell, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet.
Your movement doesn't provoke attacks of opportunity.
Ranged attacks against you are made with disadvantage.

For the spell's duration, your strikes are accompanied by strong gusts of wind. Once on each of your turns when you make a successful melee attack against a hostile creature, they must also succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed back 10 feet.

spell.name: Glinteye

m.text: A fine quartz crystal worth at least 100 gp.

entries: Holding the crystal up to your eyeline and looking through it, you perceive the true value of objects. For the duration of the spell, you can instantly determine the following information about any object you can see within 30 feet of you:
The object's approximate worth in gp, and a fair market price for the object (if any)
Whether or not the object possesses a magical aura
Any historical or scholarly significance possessed by the object
Whether or not the object was stolen within the last 10 days

spell.name: Guiding Stars
entries: Small floating stars appear, marking the safest pathway out of an area (if one exists). They twinkle brightest the moment before danger emerges, preventing you from being surprised during combat for the spell's duration.
You can end the spell early as a bonus action. When you do, you can grant yourself or an allied creature within range advantage on its next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.

spell.name: Haunting Echo
entries: You hurl a disparaging insult at a creature within range that barrages its mind. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} psychic damage on a failed saving throw or half as much on a successful one. On a failed save the insult echoes, also causing the creature to be {@condition deafened} and react oddly.
At the start of the creature's next turn, roll a {@dice d4} and consult the table below to see how the creature reacts.

rows: The creature drops anything it is holding and crumples to its knees, clutching its head. The creature can't move or take actions this turn.
The creature is shaken and has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until the start of its next turn.

The creature lashes out, using its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the creature instead attacks the nearest object.

spell.name: Healing Haze

components.m: A drop of water and a puff of air.

entries: A cloud of silvery mist materializes in a 10-footradius sphere within range, obscuring everything within it. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the cloud up to 30 feet in any direction. While concentrating on the spell, you can use an action to have the cloud sprinkle a gentle drizzle of rainfall down on anything within the fog. Each creature caught in the rain regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

spell.name: Hearth & Home

m.text: A small flintstone and a pile of tinder, which the spell consumes.

entries: You conjure a small flagstone hearth in a space within 5 feet of you. The hearth is lit with a magical flame that emits bright light in a 20-foot radius, dim light for an additional 20 feet, and tangible warmth. For the duration, you can light or extinguish this flame as an action, but otherwise, the hearth remains lit until dispelled.

While the hearth is lit, you can sense where it is in your mind and know the shortest (though not the safest) path to reach it. If you move farther than 1 mile from the conjured hearth or cast this spell again, the hearth disappears and the spell ends.

spell.name: Isolate
entries: You cause a creature within range to take on a form that reflects its innermost evil. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or assume an unsettling, monstrous appearance for the duration. While transformed, the creature is plagued with dread and takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by the psychic damage falls {@condition unconscious} but is stable.

This spell causes allies of the affected creature to be repulsed by the sight of them. Until the spell ends, any creature who attempts to heal the affected creature, target the affected creature with a beneficial spell, or render other forms of aid to the affected creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature rendering aid to the affected creature must choose a new target for the spell or effect, or the spell or effect fails.

This spell doesn't prevent the affected creature from benefiting from area effects, such as standing inside a magic circle. If the affected creature honestly surrenders, allows itself to be captured, or performs a selfless act on another's behalf, the isolate spell immediately ends.
This spell has no effect on a creature that is immune to psychic damage.

spell.name: Khaluz's Blessing
entries: You chant a holy phrase as the weapon in your hand begins to glow. You can channel this light into burning rays that scorch your enemies. The weapon radiates bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

When you cast this spell, you use the weapon's light to make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see within 60 feet. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} radiant damage. Once per turn and while concentrating on the spell, as an action you can repeat the attack. If a feature (like Extra {@action Attack}) grants you one or more additional attacks when you take the {@action Attack} action, you can only use one of your attacks to launch the burning rays. You use your additional attacks normally.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Kiss of Witch Hazel
entries: Your kind words are infused with the power of the fabled mage witch, Hazel. A breeze carries your murmurs to an allied creature, enveloping it in a soothing fragrance that bolsters its vital energies. A target within range regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier. If the allied creature is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or {@condition poisoned}, it can immediately repeat its saving throw against the effect, ending it on a success.
This spell has no effect on constructs or undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the target heals an extra {@dice 1d6} hit points for every slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Metabolise
entries: You transform your body into the ultimate devourer, capable of eating and gaining nourishment from almost anything. While active, your bite can cut or crush any nonmagical object. Furthermore, if you eat anything that is harmful (such as poison or lava) you have resistance to any damage the substance or object would deal and advantage on saving throws to resist harmful effects caused by what you eat.
As an action, you can consume 5 cubic feet worth of material within your reach, destroying the material to regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can consume an additional 5 cubic feet worth of material and regain an additional {@dice 1d10} hit points per action for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Mind Marble
entries: This spell allows you to manage thoughts and memories in the form of pea-sized spheres. These spheres, called mind marbles, can be carried and are nearly weightless. A sphere can be destroyed by an effect that dispels or suppresses a 6th level spell, but it is otherwise indestructible. This spell can be used in one of two ways, chosen when you cast the spell. If either version of the spell is cast on an unwilling target, the creature can resist with a successful Wisdom saving throw. The creature makes this saving throw with advantage if it is hostile or distrustful toward you.

entries.name: Pluck
entries: You can touch a creature (including yourself) to remove its thoughts and store them in a mind marble. When casting the spell, you choose some knowledge, skill, or memory to take from the target. This can be as simple as "skill with longswords" or as complex as "the night of the autumn ball, from dusk to dawn." Whatever information you take is removed from the creature's thoughts. If knowledge was taken, the creature forgets it, but if a specific memory was taken, the creature is aware of the memory's absence despite being unable to recall it. Class features and information that a creature needs to survive (like knowing how to walk or breathe) can't be plucked.

entries.name: Plant
entries: You can plant a mind marble you possess into your mind or the mind of another creature within range by pressing the orb into the creature's body. Once planted, the mind marble dissipates and the thoughts it contains take root within the mind of the target. Skills and knowledge are transferred seamlessly. Any memories planted in a creature's mind can be experienced from a first-person perspective by spending 10 minutes in quiet meditation. A creature always knows the difference between a memory that has been planted and its own.

spell.name: Nature's Guide

components.m: A musical instrument and a morsel of food.

entries: You play an alluring song, beckoning a nearby beast or monstrosity. By offering the beckoned creature the morsel of food, it agrees to serve as your guide. The type of creature is chosen by the GM based on your location. The creature is considered {@condition charmed} for the duration of the spell, but the spell ends if combat begins or if the creature takes damage.

You and the {@condition charmed} creature have an empathic link through which you can share simple concepts and emotions. The creature imparts its knowledge of the terrain to you and can lead you toward another creature, object, or place that you seek so long as the creature is familiar with it. The creature also leads you along paths that avoid places or creatures that it recognizes as dangerous. For example, if the creature is hunted, it avoids its predators. The creature cannot be surprised while the spell is active and informs you whenever it senses a hostile creature or situation.

You can end the spell as an action, at which point the {@condition charmed} condition ends and the creature leaves. If the spell is ended by combat or by damage dealt to the creature, there is a 50 percent chance it becomes hostile toward you and attacks.

spell.name: Nettle's Needlework

m.text: A pair of scissors, fine thread, and a silver sewing needle worth at least 50 gp.

entries: You can cut apart or stitch together an object of your choice. Choose one when you cast this spell.

entries.name: Cut
entries: You can make a surgical cut up to 20 feet long and no more than 5 feet deep into a surface or freestanding object. For the duration, the surrounding surface becomes pliable like fabric and can be pulled open as wide as 5 feet. The cut can be used by creatures to pass through the object or be used to conceal themselves inside of the object (if the interior dimensions of the object allow). When not pulled open, the cut can't be detected by the naked eye, although anyone investigating the area can discover the cut with an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. Alternatively, you can make a single, continuous cut through a nonmagical object less than 5 feet wide to slice it into separate parts. If the two parts are not rejoined before the spell ends, the cut becomes permanent.

entries.name: Stitch
entries: You use your needle and thread to magically sew two objects together so long as the two connected objects do not exceed a volume of 125 cubic feet. This can be used to simply mend a broken object or to seal an entrance by sewing a door to its frame. Once you finish your needlework, the threads disappear, and the objects fuse together at the seam for the duration.

spell.name: Rekindle

components.m: A piece of charcoal made from animal bone.

entries: You touch a corpse, immolating it to give its memories form. A fiery spirit assumes the appearance of the deceased creature and plays out the actions it took in life. For the spell to work, the corpse can't be undead and must be mostly intact.

The spirit uses the stat block for a fire elemental. When you cast this spell, you immediately know how long the creature lived. As you are concentrating on the spell, you can influence the spirit to act out any event from its life. The spirit peacefully reenacts the movements of the deceased without moving from the spot where the corpse was. With a dry and raspy voice that sounds like crackling tinder, it repeats the same words it spoke in life.

You can choose to end the spell and disperse the spirit as an action, but if your concentration is broken or the spirit takes damage at any point, the spirit doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the spirit, it becomes hostile toward all creatures within sight, and it might attack. An uncontrolled spirit can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

spell.name: Tangled Growth

m.text: A poultice of herbs, roots, and powdered silver worth at least 50 gp, which the spell consumes.

entries: You sprinkle the poultice in a circle around you, creating a zone of protective natural magic. The spell's area becomes covered in tangled vines, blooming with sweet-smelling flowers that last for the duration of the spell. When you finish casting the spell, choose any number of creatures you can see (including yourself). These creatures have advantage on all saving throws while within the circle.

When hostile creatures enter the area for the first time on their turn or start their turn within the area, the vegetation attacks them with constricting vines. They must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage and become {@condition grappled} by the vines. The escape DC is equal to your spell save DC. On a success, a creature takes half damage and is not {@condition grappled}.

spell.name: Wrath of Roots
entries: You summon snaking roots that erupt from the earth and enact nature's wrath. As the roots spread they tear up the ground, making it difficult terrain. Each creature within a 20-foot radius centered on a point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 7d12} bludgeoning damage and becomes {@condition restrained} on a failed save, or takes half as much damage on a success. A {@condition restrained} creature can attempt a Strength saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success. A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried takes double damage if it's in the spell's range.

When casting the spell, you can choose to have the roots shoot up into the air instead of spreading laterally. If you do so, the radius of the spell is reduced to 10 feet and its vertical reach is increased to 40 feet. Any flying creatures within the area of the spell's effect that fail the saving throw are forced to the ground and are {@condition restrained} (but do not suffer any falling damage).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, increase the bludgeoning damage dealt by the spell by {@dice 2d12} for every slot level above 7th.
